title: Album Page, "Campanile of Palazzo Vecchio and Details of Ironwork, Florence", November 16, 1888
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
markings: Paper-maker's mark embossed in support (bottom right corner of sheet and upside down in relation to drawing): an oval with "J M P" in center, ornament above and a small banner that reads "BRISTOL" below.
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, top right corner: (inscribed in circle) 89 / 102.  At bottom edge: Florence / Nov 16th 1888. At bottom right: Nov; at bottom left: scale .20 = 1m.  Inscriptions about scale, clockwise from top right: .12; <.06 1/2>; cornice and / string courses on / palace; (no scale).
description: Vertical sheet with many small sketches of ironwork, architectural details and, the largest of the sketches, a view of the campanile of the Palazzo Vecchio as seen from the back or side.  Many of the drawings for ironwork are reddish-gray, as if to indicate rust or patina.  Two types of ironwork (possibly used for hitching a horse?) are shown from the front and in profile  There is another small ring at upper right shown in a three-quarter view and also from the side.  Many of the sketches bear notations about their scale.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Campanile of Palazzo Vecchio and Details of Ironwork, Florence", November 16, 1888.
November 16, 1888. Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-159.
